conclusion: To determine the car's acceleration from the given x-t (position-time) graph, we need to follow these steps.
The graph shows the position x over time t.
The slope of the position-time graph gives velocity.
The slope of the velocity-time graph gives acceleration.
From the graph, the slope at t = 0 is given as 10 m/s, indicating the initial velocity.
The graph shows a straight line, which means the velocity is constant.

premise: The graph shows a straight line, which means the velocity is constant.
conclusion: Since the velocity is constant, the acceleration is zero.
The equation x = -2t + 10 represents the motion.
